meanings.definition: To spread out for drying, as hay
meanings.sent1: She tedded the hay in the field to help it dry faster.
meanings.sent2: The farmer tedded the hay to ensure it dried evenly.
meanings.sent3: The hay was tedded so well that even the birds wanted to join in the sunbathing.
meanings.sent4: The sun tedded its rays across the sky, warming everything below.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tedded hay fields stayed vivid in her mind for days.

meanings.definition: To toss or spread out for examination or sorting
meanings.sent1: He tedded the papers on his desk to find the missing document.
meanings.sent2: The librarian tedded the books on the shelves to organize them by genre.
meanings.sent3: The detective tedded the clues on the table, trying to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: She tedded her thoughts, trying to make sense of the jumbled mess in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The teacher tedded the students' assignments, looking for the best one in the pile.
